'' Zahi Hawass was not yet a member of Mubarak's cabinet when Parker profiled him in 2009, but was already prone to statements of his influence. Parker writes that when he met Zahi Hawass , his dominant conversational tone was rebuttal laced with invective and self-regard, built on the premise-it has some merit-that the international standing of Egypt is powerfully connected to the standing of Zahi Hawass . He has no doubt that his fame is a vital national asset. And it's an asset likely to carry over even if the Mubarak government falls, Parker says. On his Twitter account on Thursday, Eric Schmidt wrote: Day-to-day adult supervision is no longer needed. ''I believe Larry is ready'' to take over as CEO, Eric Schmidt said during a call with analysts. ''It's time for him to have a shot at running this.''

The Democrats, who used similar messaging leading up to the healthcare reform repeal vote, are trying to paint Republican healthcare efforts as a distraction from creating jobs. I do not understand how this Republican Congress can move from that mandate to create jobs, to create opportunities in this country, toward how we undermine women's reproductive health, said Barbara Boxer Kirsten Gillibrand ( D-N.Y.).
